post.body:
I've noticed that Europeans tend to be more multi-talented, competent, and intelligent in my experience. They have a history of being more creative, for example literally all the famous artists and musicians. They tend to be more polite, more productive, and capable of learning more. For example most Europeans know 3+ languages and can speak all of them perfectly fluently, completely comfortably, whereas Americans can only speak English, and even if they learn another language they struggle to comfortably hold a conversation in it. They often can debate, do math, draw, play music, program, etc. very well more than the average American. The only thing Europeans don't have a monopoly on as far as I can tell is classic literature.

America is great and we have a better (notice I did not say good) government, more freedom, a better economy, and are the world's superpower, and without us the other countries couldn't survive. But I kinda feel like we as a whole are pretty stupid comparatively speaking. I don't think this is all laziness, because in America hard work seems to be a much bigger value, so I doubt it's any fault of our own. It's probably a genetic factor relating to our IQ that we can't control (which is very odd since most white Americans came from European ancestors, but it's what I've observed).

body:
> American education has been a bit of a joke for a while now.

That's true and I think it accounts for some of the difference but even when Americans educate themselves on something the same way, they usually still produce inferior results.

> Learning languages is a matter of practice more than understanding and is generally less cerebral than trying to teach yourself maths or science.

I know lots of Americans who have learned languages, including myself. However the most they can ever do is barely translate the most simple passages, and not speak in it, whereas Europeans can often fully comfortably hold complex conversations in multiple languages.

> I don't know enough about art and music, but I would take a stab and argue that Europe had a massive head start as far as classical composers go.

What do you mean by "head start"? I feel like they just have brighter and more creative minds in general. They seem to be the natural talent vs the hard work of Americans. Unfortunately in my experience natural talent is *far* superior to hard work, even when it gives hardly any effort. Nurture can influence things but it never beats nature.

parent.body:
American education has been a bit of a joke for a while now. That's more a reflection of priorities than capability, though. Europe will steadily decline now that they've been invaded with low IQ migrants and their priorities will shift to lifting them up instead of their own people.

There's nothing stopping the majority of individuals from educating themselves these days. Learning languages is a matter of practice more than understanding and is generally less cerebral than trying to teach yourself maths or science. I don't know enough about art and music, but I would take a stab and argue that Europe had a massive head start as far as classical composers go. 

Now compare Europe with the rest of the world.

parent.body:
>Why does he need a man or a Prophet or a Messiah or "Himself" to die to be able to instantly forgive your sins?

>Because he is also committed to justice, and it's what makes the gift so perfect.

That doesn't make any sense. God has absolute authority, control, and knowledge over everything that has or ever will exist. He does not need causality. He does not need to have something within this creation happen for something else to happen. His will is executed perfectly at all times. Nothing will ever or has ever happened except by His allowance and predestiny. Jesus, whether or not he is a form of God - polytheism by definition, did not need to die to give God permission to forgive you for your sins. God could dissolve Satan instantly right now if He wanted to. God could transmute this existence into nonexistence instantly if he wanted to. To say that a man or God had to die to forgive your sins is blasphemy. It explicitly limits the abilities and omnipotence of the one true God. 

This misunderstanding is so serious that a final Prophet had to come to teach all people the religion of Christ, which is simply submission to the will of God, and the sole worship of Him alone. Mohamed sallahu alayhi wasalam came to all of mankind, not just the lost sheep (non Juden) of the Israelites (Europeans).

Why do you vote?  To be an accomplice in what ever pyschopath politician enacts and enforces?  Do you enjoy imposing your will on others?

A Christian only serves one and that is God.  You cannot serve both your government and God.

body: > And God said, “Let there be a vault between the waters to separate water from water.” **So God made the vault and separated the water under the vault from the water above it**. And it was so. God called the vault “sky.” And there was evening, and there was morning, the second day. And God said, **“Let the water under the sky be gathered to one place, and let dry ground appear.”** And it was so. God called the dry ground “land,” and the gathered waters he called “seas.” And God saw that it was good.

parent.body:
This is describing how the Earth was constructed with the two waters separated. 

The Quran is rather describing how God made the beginning of the existence of the universe out of a single point ("a single mass"), and then cleft it asunder. The word used for the cleaving is the same word that is used for when a piece of worn clothing bursts at the seams. This is what happened before God made the Earth as described in Genesis. This is where the matter came from.

This is exactly what basic 20th century science shows. If you look at stars, and know their color barely tints blue or red if they are moving towards or away from you (at thousands of miles per second), you quickly realize that the entire heavens (including the Earth) came from a single point: a big bursting, an explosion.

This does not conflict with the account of genesis, it merely precedes it by a time. The existence was made first so that the Earth could be formed within it.

body:
You've done the impossible if you ever convince someone to question it though. Iirc the only one who ever did is Ron Paul and I am the only one I know who took him seriously.

This is probably one of the few areas where European countries are more libertarian than the US, though they still make it compulsory, just to a much lesser extent (which is still too much) and it's more career/gymnasium focused rather than drilling the 3 core academic subjects into everyone's skulls and "do everything we can to beat China's totally honest test scores!". I've heard a lot of them are at least willing to get rid of the disruptive students who don't want to be there too.

I'm not sure what happened that got so many people on board with this in the US, but you're automatically not worth listening to if you dare question it. I suppose it profits for the deep state somehow but I'm perplexed as to how. It sucks and ruins everyone's younger lives but at least Obama's term limit ended before he had his chance to make it even worse.

body:
I don't really trust Trump but I do like the fact that he's an outsider. The swamp is used to having everything set up and along comes Trump who is more of an independent conman with competing interests. That's why they hate him so much. The same could be said about Bernie Sanders.

I'm also not fond of this new version of "conservative". Previously it meant sticking to the legal system and rights that the nation was founded on as closely as possible. Now it seems more are going in the direction of using government force to preserve tradition and social conformity, as part of this uniparty system developing, both sides have to agree on full government control. This definitely isn't Trump but he's way too authoritarian too, just more about his own personal interests instead of conserving the past; I have trouble thinking of Trump as a conservative by any definition, he's more of a populist catering to those fed up with the Democrats, which of course includes conservatives, but that doesn't make him one. If he thinks something is stupid he won't mind banning it, because he's the greatest person ever and no one has ever been greater than him and he can never be wrong.

post.body:
You might think I'm spouting nonsense here but hear me out. Basically all of the Democrats and Republicans pretending they're butting heads is just an act. Their goal is to make everyone think they're divided and focus on taking one side, while in reality they both will pass the exact same things. It's clear they collude together and it's all for deep state profit.

You'll notice how most of our "political" controversies are petty arguments over religion, college campuses, lgbt, television shows, social media, BLM, etc. that have absolutely nothing to do with politics. Yet the division works, and we find people strongly taking one side or the other...as both sides pass the exact same things! All the actual political arguments, like the economy, checks and balances, rights, etc. are either secondary or completely off the table. Think about it, there's a ton of things no one ever questions and if you do you're *immediately* dismissed as a lunatic:

* The federal government is the main decision maker in every aspect of life

* Very exhaustive k-12 academic indoctrination is a requirement

* Insanely restrictive ip laws prohibit even internet memes as a huge felony (more the fault of international organizations than the US)

* The federal government is very strong and can literally do whatever it wants as long as all the politicians agree

* We blindly listen to the elites and go through the system of school, college, 9-5 job, die

* Rights are considered outdated and "collective" interests are generally viewed as more important

* The government is the true owner of all your property and even your life, as it can dictate it and you even rent your land and income from them (taxes).

* The majority always rules and everyone must conform

* Everyone must vote Democrat or Republican, and if you don't vote the same as someone else you're their enemy

* Anyone who questions the system is just an whining idiot extremist who should not be listened to

There are plenty more things, but the point is all the actual political stuff is completely unanimous: full government totalitarian control to profit the deep state. All this show of the Republicans and Democrats supposedly hating each other is just a distraction. Wake up people, your candidates' "positions" are nothing more than their personal opinions. All the politicians vote for the exact same things. The US is just a one party state: the federalist party; that disguises itself as two to keep us sheep distracted from that fact.

You might think I'm spouting nonsense here but hear me out. Basically all of the Democrats and Republicans pretending they're butting heads is just an act. Their goal is to make everyone think they're divided and focus on taking one side, while in reality they both will pass the exact same things. It's clear they collude together and it's all for deep state profit.

You'll notice how most of our "political" controversies are petty arguments over religion, college campuses, lgbt, television shows, social media, BLM, etc. that have absolutely nothing to do with politics. Yet the division works, and we find people strongly taking one side or the other...as both sides pass the exact same things! All the actual political arguments, like the economy, checks and balances, rights, etc. are either secondary or completely off the table. Think about it, there's a ton of things no one ever questions and if you do you're *immediately* dismissed as a lunatic:

* The federal government is the main decision maker in every aspect of life

* Very exhaustive k-12 academic indoctrination is a requirement

* Insanely restrictive ip laws prohibit even internet memes as a huge felony (more the fault of international organizations than the US)

* The federal government is very strong and can literally do whatever it wants as long as all the politicians agree

* We blindly listen to the elites and go through the system of school, college, 9-5 job, die

* Rights are considered outdated and "collective" interests are generally viewed as more important

* The government is the true owner of all your property and even your life, as it can dictate it and you even rent your land and income from them (taxes).

* The majority always rules and everyone must conform

* Everyone must vote Democrat or Republican, and if you don't vote the same as someone else you're their enemy

* Anyone who questions the system is just an whining idiot extremist who should not be listened to

There are plenty more things, but the point is all the actual political stuff is completely unanimous: full government totalitarian control to profit the deep state. All this show of the Republicans and Democrats supposedly hating each other is just a distraction. Wake up people, your candidates' "positions" are nothing more than their personal opinions. All the politicians vote for the exact same things. The US is just a one party state: the federalist party; that disguises itself as two to keep us sheep distracted from that fact.

body:
Trump hates big business because it's his competition. Also almost all public figures do good deeds for the sake of their reputation.

I don't deny that Trump cares about the people, but I think his judgement is clouded by his enormous ego and pride, and I still think he probably puts himself first.

parent.body:
So you don’t think he cares about Americans? If he was really about enriching big business he would have done different things. Trump was known as a compassionate and generous man before he was president. 

In 1986, Trump prevented the foreclosure of Annabell Hill’s family farm after her husband committed suicide. Trump personally phoned down to the auction to stop the sale of her home and offered the widow money. Trump decided to take action after he saw Hill’s pleas for help in news reports.

In 1988, a commercial airline refused to fly Andrew Ten, a sick Orthodox Jewish child with a rare illness, across the country to get medical care because he had to travel with an elaborate life-support system. His grief stricken parents contacted Trump for help and he didn’t hesitate to send his own plane to take the child from Los Angeles to New York so he could get his treatment.

In 1991, 200 Marines who served in Operation Desert Storm spent time at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina before they were scheduled to return home to their families. However, the Marines were told that a mistake had been made and an aircraft would not be able to take them home on their scheduled departure date. When Trump got wind of this, he sent his plane to make two trips from North Carolina to Miami to safely return the Gulf War Marines to their loved ones.

In 1995, a motorist stopped to help Trump after the limo he was traveling in got a flat tire. Trump asked the Good Samaritan how he could repay him for his help. All the man asked for was a bouquet of flowers for his wife. A few weeks later Trump sent the flowers with a note that read: “We’ve paid off your mortgage."

In 1996, Trump filed a lawsuit against the city of Palm Beach, Florida accusing the town of discriminating against his Mar-a-Lago resort club because it allowed Jews and blacks. Abraham Foxman, who was the Anti-Defamation League Director at the time, said Trump “put the light on Palm Beach – not on the beauty and the glitter, but on its seamier side of discrimination.” Foxman also noted that Trump’s charge had a trickle-down effect because other clubs followed his lead and began admitting Jews and blacks.

In 2000, Maury Povich featured a little girl named Megan who struggled with Brittle Bone Disease on his show and Trump happened to be watching. Trump said the little girl’s story and positive attitude touched his heart. So he contacted Maury and gifted the little girl and her family with a very generous check.

In 2008, after Jennifer Hudson’s family members were tragically murdered in Chicago, Trump put the Oscar-winning actress and her family up at his Windy City hotel for free. In addition to that, Trump’s security took extra measures to ensure Hudson and her family members were safe during such a difficult time.

In 2013, New York bus driver Darnell Barton spotted a woman close to the edge of a bridge staring at traffic below as he drove by. He stopped the bus, got out and put his arm around the woman and saved her life by convincing her to not jump. When Trump heard about this story, he sent the hero bus driver a check simply because he believed his good deed deserved to be rewarded.

In 2014, Trump gave $25,000 to Sgt. Andrew Tahmooressi after he spent seven months in a Mexican jail for accidentally crossing the US-Mexico border. President Barack Obama couldn’t even be bothered to make one phone call to assist with the United States Marine’s release; however, Trump opened his pocketbook to help this serviceman get back on his feet.

In 2016, Melissa Consin Young attended a Trump rally and tearfully thanked Trump for changing her life. She said she proudly stood on stage with Trump as Miss Wisconsin USA in 2005. However, years later she found herself struggling with an incurable illness and during her darkest days she explained that she received a handwritten letter from Trump telling her she’s the “bravest woman, I know.” She said the opportunities that she got from Trump and his organizations ultimately provided her Mexican-American son with a full-ride to college.

Lynne Patton, a black female executive for the Trump Organization, released a statement in 2016 defending her boss against accusations that he’s a racist and a bigot. She tearfully revealed how she’s struggled with substance abuse and addiction for years. Instead of kicking her to the curb, she said the Trump Organization and his entire family loyally stood by her through “immensely difficult times.”

https://townhall.com/columnists/lizcrokin/2016/07/10/trump-does-the-unthinkable-n2190160

Also everyone forgets that Trump donates his presidential salary:

2017 first quarter: donated to The Department of the Interior for The National Park Service, for the preservation, security and maintenance projects of the nation’s 25 battlefields.

2017 2nd quarter: The Department of Education, which would fund science, engineering, technology, and math STEM focused camp for students.

2017 3rd quarter: Health and Human Services to help combat the opioid epidemic.

2017 4th quarter: Department of Transportation – Supporting and modernizing crumbling and falling infrastructures.

2018 1st quarter: The Department of Veteran’s Affairs to support its Caregiver Programs.

2018 2nd quarter: The Small Business Administrations, in support of Veteran program called “Emerging Leaders” which is an adaptation program for transitioning Veterans who are in process of leaving the military world and entering the civilian world and job markets, this program makes job and career endeavors hopeful with training and possible Entrepreneurship.

2018 3rd quarter: The National Institute on Alcohol Abuse & Alcoholism, researching the disease of alcoholism. Which by the way affects many of our returning veterans from the ravages of war.

2018 4th quarter: Department of Homeland Security, which is comprised of many agencies focusing on securing the United States and it’s citizens regarding citizenship and immigration services, the Coast Guard, the Secret Service, Transportation Security Administration, Immigration and Customs Enforcement and Federal Emergency Management Agency among others included under the umbrella of DHS.

2019 1st quarter: USDA-The Department of Agriculture- Outreach programs that benefit farmers.

2019 2nd quarter: The Surgeon General’s Office – Funding upcoming public health advisory, protecting the health and safety of all Americans.

2019 3rd quarter: The Office of the Assistant Secretary of Health – To continue the ongoing fight against the opioid crisis by overseeing federal public health offices and programs.

2019 4th quarter: The Department of Health and Human Services – To help confront, contain, and combat coronavirus.

2020 1st quarter: The Department of Health and Human Services – To develop new therapies for treating and preventing coronavirus.

https://americaoutloud.com/organizations-president-trump-donated-his-salary-to-from-2017-to-present/

Trump also writes the letters to families of fallen soldiers and when he can, goes to receive the body with the family.

> But the rage of the masses also counts for something. The country is going to fall because half of us hate the other half and vice-versa. And that, my friend, is two parties in action.

No, that's the orchestrated division tactic of *one* party that seeks to divide its population to 1) distract them from the fact that both "sides" are really no different politically and keep voting for them by voting for their "side", and 2) make them weaker and easier to control. So they made up a bunch of bullshit issues that *seem* like opposites, but in reality are just personal opinions that have nothing to do with politics; they both will pass the exact same things. I'm surprised how well it's worked, people are going completely nuts over personal disagreements that shouldn't be controversies, let alone life and death.

post.body:
You might think I'm spouting nonsense here but hear me out. Basically all of the Democrats and Republicans pretending they're butting heads is just an act. Their goal is to make everyone think they're divided and focus on taking one side, while in reality they both will pass the exact same things. It's clear they collude together and it's all for deep state profit.

You'll notice how most of our "political" controversies are petty arguments over religion, college campuses, lgbt, television shows, social media, BLM, etc. that have absolutely nothing to do with politics. Yet the division works, and we find people strongly taking one side or the other...as both sides pass the exact same things! All the actual political arguments, like the economy, checks and balances, rights, etc. are either secondary or completely off the table. Think about it, there's a ton of things no one ever questions and if you do you're *immediately* dismissed as a lunatic:

* The federal government is the main decision maker in every aspect of life

* Very exhaustive k-12 academic indoctrination is a requirement

* Insanely restrictive ip laws prohibit even internet memes as a huge felony (more the fault of international organizations than the US)

* The federal government is very strong and can literally do whatever it wants as long as all the politicians agree

* We blindly listen to the elites and go through the system of school, college, 9-5 job, die

* Rights are considered outdated and "collective" interests are generally viewed as more important

* The government is the true owner of all your property and even your life, as it can dictate it and you even rent your land and income from them (taxes).

* The majority always rules and everyone must conform

* Everyone must vote Democrat or Republican, and if you don't vote the same as someone else you're their enemy

* Anyone who questions the system is just an whining idiot extremist who should not be listened to

There are plenty more things, but the point is all the actual political stuff is completely unanimous: full government totalitarian control to profit the deep state. All this show of the Republicans and Democrats supposedly hating each other is just a distraction. Wake up people, your candidates' "positions" are nothing more than their personal opinions. All the politicians vote for the exact same things. The US is just a one party state: the federalist party; that disguises itself as two to keep us sheep distracted from that fact.

body:
More of that "new" conservatism. People don't even know what conservative is supposed to mean anymore. It's *supposed* to be preserving the limited government and rights of the people that the nation was founded on, our philosophy of rights, freedom, limited government, and markets. Now people seem to think it's using government control to *forcefully* preserve Greco-Roman traditions like a culturally right-wing SJW. The reason is that "conservatives" now are actually leftists in disguise to distract the populace so they can get 100% of the vote.

[Don't fall for the deep state's plot. Big government's federalist agenda is to make people think there's two opposite sides by distracting them with controversies completely unrelated to politics, when both sides are actually the same and everyone votes for them foolishly thinking they're any different. In reality, it's all one party, the part of big government, and the "two" sides pass the exact same things while putting up a show of arguing over petty matters.](https://ruqqus.com/+UnpopularOpinion/post/6g2d/the-us-is-a-oneparty-state)
